page: MS60019: Mechanical And Thermal Behaviour Of Polymers

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Prerequisite: None Elastic, viscoelastic and flow behaviour of polymers, theory of linear viscoelasticity, creep and stress relaxations in polymers, super position principle and time-temperature equivalence, stress-strain behavior of polymers and the dependence of stress-strain curve on internal and external factors, plastic behaviour of polymers, concept of forced elasticity and zarkov relation, fatigue and life time of polymers, fracture of polymers, principles of reinforcement in polymers, strengthening mechanism in polymers. Thermal transitions in polymers, glass rubber transition (Tg) and flow transition (Tf), melting of crystalline polymers, thermal degradation, thermal expansion in polymers, theory of thermal conductivity and specific heat of polymers, thermal transitions in polymers, thermogravimetry, differential scanning calorimetry, thermomechanical behaviour and analysis.
page: MS60019: Mechanical And Thermal Behaviour Of Polymers
